subject: Languages
title: Real-Time Translation: The Babel Fish Dream
description: A micro-lesson that makes Real-Time Translation: The Babel Fish Dream usable.

hook.text: Douglas Adams imagined a 'Babel fish' you put in your ear for instant translation. We're getting close.

buildup.text: Earbuds like Google Pixel Buds now offer real-time speech translation in dozens of languages.

discovery.text: The tech chains three AI systems: speech recognition, translation, and voice synthesis.

twist.text: Lag, errors, and lack of emotional tone make the experience awkward â€” functional but not natural.

climax.text: Within a decade, real-time translation may make foreign language learning seem optional to many.

punchline.text: The universal translator is almost here. What we lose with it is harder to measure.

quiz.question: What science fiction concept predicted real-time translation devices?
options: The Babel fish from Hitchhiker's Guide
